author: sith_assassin
title: yes i finally have it
review:
right now i am sitting starring at it thinking its beautiful. the minifigures are great and they are all new. juno eclipse with blond hair and alternate imp hat. new vader's apprentice witch has a name but has not yet been realsed yet. i want the game force unleashed so much. if you think the battle damaged vader is cool you are kinda wrong. i thought that the broken helmet was new but its not. you know the old diver visors it is just a black one of those. vader also comes with his regular helmet.

the rogue shadow is so cool. on the left side it has a gun that you pull a lever it comes out and the trigger hits the ship and shoots. on the right side in the front there is a compartment for two of the new snipers. on the right in the back are some weird red grey and tan missles that dont really fire. the cockpit is roomy compared to others. this set has alot of secrets compartments and doors. it also has some cool landing gear on the bottom.

A MUST HAVE FOR 2008

author: thepeopleperson
title: Absolutely perfect!
review:
This is one of my favorite sets.  It has 3 all new minifigs, and lots of working features. Here's a list of pros and cons.

pros-
very sleek
minifigs
secret compartments
hidden firing rocket
A new kind of flick-fire missiles
the engine turns when you direct the wings
a big set for the price ($50)

cons-
landing gear is fragile

As I said before, this is an awesome set.  Buy this set and you will not be dissapointed.

author: apt142
title: Best set I've built  in a long while.
review:
I bought this set recently.  I bought it because the reviews were good and because I was able to get it inexpensively.

The ship on the box looks kind of cool but, it just didn't grab my attention.  To be honest, I wasn't expecting it to be as fun as it was to build.  This set is very, very cool.  

Pro's:
Very cool design.  Images don't do it justice because there is a lot of detail just doesn't come out.  Every contour and compartment was well thought out when this was designed. The engine and wings are especially interesting.

This set has lot's of hidden items, features, and functionality: The missle compartment, the spring loaded gun, the landing gears, the weapons stash.  Even the cockpit's opening mechanism was creative.  

Sturdy construction.

Con's:
I was disappointed that only one of the mini-figs fit in the ship.


All in all a very awesome addition to anybody's collection.

author: sudorum
title: Some Good, Some Bad
review: There are some pretty cool mini figures in this set. The battle scarred Darth Vader is extremely detailed, as is his apprentice. The Juno Eclipse minifigure is all new too. The ship itself with an opening cockpit has plenty of room for any of the figures. A flap on the ship opens to reveal a cannon that automatically shoots, and a hyperdrive back engine that flips the wings. One flaw about this is that the wings cannot flip completely when the ship is stationary. It has to be airborne for that to transpire. Another flaw- the support legs for this ship are absolutely flimsy and are only present to aggravate the owner. Also, I don't understand why a store of guns is included in a compartment of the ship. Since when did the Sith use guns?

author: pizpag
title: This set blows me away!
review:
I got this set for my birthday and immediately wanted to build it. It has awsome figures and tons of hidden weapons.

  Pros: Awesome figures 
        Hidden sniper rifles
        Hidden homing missles and huge hidden blast cannon
        Wings that switch for landing is cool

  Cons: Where does the apprentice sit?
        Stickers ugh

author: ocre
title: Good, but not great
review: This is a pretty cool set with lots of intersting pieces and the mini figures you get are pretty cool too. I think the design is litte wierd but if your interested in star wars you should still definitley buy it, if your not, wait for another set.

author: David1971
title: A bit of an odd-looking ship
review:
This is a good Lego version of the Rogue Shadow ship designed by Lucasfilm, and has lots of clever hidden-away bits and bobs, and a good wing-rotating mechanism. (Amazon UK was selling it at 23 per cent off the standard price, which was a good thing too).

The original design of the ship, though, is not that nice. The classic Star Wars ships such as the X-Wing and the TIE fighters were very cool, sleek, and symmetrical. This is a bit clunky and I personally very much dislike the lack of symmetry, so it has different wierd big bits sticking out on the left and the right.

The three minifigs are nice, but this of course leads to the other notable problem with this set - only one of them can fly in it at once, despite its rather huge proportions! What an oversight. Darth Vader has to leave both his apprentice and his pilot at home when he goes off on a mission. No wonder he ended up 'battle-damaged'. Add some seats for your crew, Darth! They might be helpful. Mr Vader really is not a team player, is he?

author: tonga256
title: dark side away!
review:
This is one of the greatest sets I have. Its a little hard too build but its worth it. This thing is more bigger and better than it looks. It can do so much you`ll be amazed just like I was.

PROS.
landing gear,
three hidden missles,
hidden blasters for ground battle,
three mini figuree,
cotpit opens,
movable wings and enging.

CONS.
landing gear faltey,
hard too build,
can only fit one mimi figure in the cotpit.

author: Leggodt94
title: An Excellent Marvel of Imperial Design!
review: I don't know what it is, but there's just something about this model that makes me feel like as soon as I let it go it'll come to life! Not many sets have this very rare "pro", but this set does. Anyways, this set comes with three multi-rare minifigs and a great model that fires a hidden missile and comes with two drop-out missiles. Also, the wings and engine adjust easily, the landing gears go up and come down, and the cockpit is easily accessible. One other thing that I have to say is that this set's model was designed very creatively: the shape of the wings, the shape and placement of the engine, and the whole cut-down-the-middle sceme of the front of the ship all add to this. This set was my most anticipated set of early 2008, and it met all of my anticipations! Great, great job LEGO with this set!

author: ngclarkiv
title: Rogue Shadow: A Very Good Set
review: When I first glanced at this set, I wasn't particularly sure about it because I have been a Star Wars Lego collector for quite some time and buying a set that was fifty bucks that wasn't from any of the six movies didn't seem worth it.  But I believe it to be a great set for anybody now and it makes me even more excited for the video game, Star Wars: The Force Unleashed to come out!!  This set is all black which made me happy because most imperial sets have the blue on it that I'm not very fond of.  Landing gear is great on it, making it easy for it to come out or put away.  I really like the all of the weapons on it including: The launch missile, two flick missiles,  and four guns on the front for detail.  There are several accessories including the gun storage area that holds to rifles on the right side, The booster on the back, when pushed up, the wings are pushed up also, a compartment to put one figure in (which I wasn't a big fan of) and only one sticker thank goodness.  The characters are also very cool with battle damaged Darth Vader, Juno Eclipse, and Vader's secret apprentice.  Vader's secret apprentice is way cool which basically makes this set a reason to buy.  In all, it is a great set and has very many hidden compartments (although not as much as the best set ever, the new Slave I) and is definitely worth the fifty bucks and the best Star Wars set that you can purchase at the moment.

author: zachary
title: Awesome set!
review:
If you like the empire this is the set to get. It includes so many rare peices and 3 cool mini-figures its also a cool set to play with though it brakes easly.
                            pros
the mini figures (Darth Vader , his apprentice and Juno Eclpce 
rare peices 
all the guns!
fun to play with
                            cons
brakes easly 

overall i'd give this set a 4\5

author: donneyboy
title: nice set
review:
this is one of the best sets i ever have gotten ( excluding the passenger plane from '06 ) heres a list of pros and cons-

pros
battle damaged vader 
vaders apprentice 
juno eclipse
big ship
hidden compartments

cons-
only one person can fit in cockpit 
stickers

onley one question since when do sith use lightsabrs?

author: Scottieuk
title: This is a GREAT set
review:
I've been looking at this set for a long time, and my main reason for not getting was that I really prefer models from the movies.
However I pretty much have every model now so went into my local shop and it was a choice between this or "The Twilight". The figures included in the Twilight set are the same as the figures in the new Clone wars AT-TE so I went for the Rogue instead.

This is one of the quickest, and most satisfying Star Wars lego models I have ever built.
Numbered bags made it really easy, I was able to build it on my lap whilst watching TV and my drinking a cup of tea.

Each bag builds a seperate module which eventually all join together to make the ship.
There was little repetition so didn't get tiresome.

The finished model looks great, very aggresive. The rotating engine looks very smart and works well with the turning foils.

The asymetrical design looks good, almost like a super Tie-bomber in style.

There are lots of hidden compartments and extras. The opening cockpit works well, with a clever mechanism. The launching missile workd really well for me and looks impressive.

People have said it's not great as it doesn't hold all the figures but I don't feel this to be an issue, it's a super charged 1 person gunship, not a troop carrier.

I feel the use of a divers helmet to simulate a battle damaged one is a great idea, i'd prefer this to using many "custom" one off pieces.

PROS

Looks great
Lots of extras and features.
3 great mini-figures.
Launcher works well.
Smart design.

CONS

Landing gear is a bit weak.
Cog mechanism is bright yellow, grey or black would look better.

author: paulsalley
title: A really cool Set
review:
I was initially unsure about this set, as its not from the movies, but from a computer game, but after consideration I decided that its still a form of Starwars entertainment so bought the set.  I'm really pleased I did.  A very enjoyable build, with lots of opening compartments and good design features, it really looks the business to!!  3 great mini figs, (although only one fits in the ship).  It is a shame you can see the ugly yellow gears that operate the revolving "wings" when the model is in flight mode, if they couldn't cover them, Lego could have at least used grey of black ones!!

Over all one of the best sets I've built so far, well worth buying!

author: wyoeaglefan
title: Pretty sweet set!
review: I received this as a gift from my sister for christmas. I was surprised to find that the construction of this model was very simple. They had the ship broken down into pieces that you built from individually numbered bags. I was intrigued to find out that the broken vader mask was just an inverted aquazone mask, however I feel the vader figure is a good representation of the vader after Starkiller whoops up on him in TFU. The cockpit could afford a resizing, and the extensive use of canons seems to overdo it compared to the videogame model. (maybe this was developed off of an early concept sketch of the Rogue Shadow?) This ship is a good buy though, and my first venture into the EU sets from Star Wars.

author: hustla187
title: Only Force Unleashed Set
review: I have seen this vehicle in the game and this set looks barely like it. It is actually silver instead of black, but the minifigs do make up for that. I like the damaged Vader minifig and the Apprentice minifig which are very cool. Lego released this set before the game came out, and should have rechecked before releasing this.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: Great to the title: the force unleashed!
review:
This is the set that appears in the new video game: star wars the force unleashed. My friend has this game, and he said, "the detail compared to the game is incredible. The minifigs are accurate, a starship i would like to own!" For only $50, the price seems high, but the minifigs pay off.

Pros:
New minifigs! Battle damaged vader, apprentice, and juno eclpise!
Includes 2 blaster rifles
Includes hat + hair for juno eclipse!
has a color scheme which says "dark"
new hard to find pieces!

Cons: 
There is a missle launcher that doesn't fire, the same one on the naboo starfighter
2 missles that are supposed to be flick fire, you can't flick it.
you can only fit 1 minifig in the cockpit! That is the only place to put a minifig!
both wings move, and turns on the engine (blue) in the back. It leaves a gaping yellow hole. 
Landing gear, poo!
reveals many compartments that don't store anything.

This may be worth it, but $50, it is pricey. It has this weird feeling when you look at it, and the homing spider droid is much better. I would personally buy something else besides this. I scraped mine, and used to peices to make other lego creations.

author: mvila09
title: 7672 Rogue Shadow
review: I finally got the time to review this set! I got this at the mall for $50 and I'm glad I got it...well sorta.You get Galen Marek(aka Starkiller),Darth Vader(battle damaged),and pilot Juno Eclipse.This ship has pretty good features like the missiles and the blaster holders and who can forget those blue pieces in the back?Well,Here's the review.Pros:Big missile,Starkiller,Vader,Juno Eclipse,Landing gear,2 instruction booklets!,2 red lightsabers,2 blaster rifles,Vader's battle damaged helmet is a diver's visor from Aquazone,Good amount of accessories,Design is accurate.Cons:Yellow piece is visible when the Rogue Shadow is in flight mode,Vader should have a battle damaged cape,I think it should include one more figure like PROXY or Rahm Kota,There are flick fire missiles you can't flick,The cockpit only fits one minifigure,There should at least be rooms to play inside with.****4 stars.

author: shinjix2
title: Only If You Have Played/Read SW:TFU
review:
If you have never played the game or read the book, you may be a little lost as to what you are building. Otherwise you will want this set. I do think that there are a few design flaws but the coolness factor overrides alot of them.

Pros:
The wings move on liftoff (can also be a con)
The hidden missles
The minifgs are all important characters
Cockpit design
Actual spring loaded missle!

Cons:
To display with wings down, you have to suspend.
Cockpit should be bigger to house minifigs.
Wish we had PROXY (I won't that against this set but it would've been cool)
Panels fall off easily
Other missles are flick firing and don't stay in

author: JTR_11
title: Actually pretty good!
review:
I got this set for Christmas and I was thinking is it going to be as good as I though it might be. It took about 45 minutes to build (exluding eating tea, I had steak by the way). As soon as I opened the box, I realized that the bags were numbered. I though Great! Then I noticed the two booklets. I didn't think it was complecated. And it wasn't. I don't know why the two booklets were needed. Anyway, I didn't realize that it did sooo much. There is the missile launcher, two flick missiles that are impossible to flick, the opening cockpit and the weapon holder. The landing gear is pretty stable and the rest of the ship seems to be sturdy. The only problem I got with this ship is that only one minifig can fit in. 
This is a great set. £50 though, bit tooooo much but it's good. BUY IT!

author: cmgc135
title: 18th Lego Set
review:
I bought this set when it was on sale for $40

Pros
- Figures (Vader, Apprentice, Juno Eclipse)
- 3 Missles (one spring loaded, the other 2 I use for bombs)
- Wings

Cons:
- If flying upward covers fro missles will fall back

Overall
4.9/5

author: pbj_club
title: what a beast!!
review:
I love this set.the build wasn't difficult.just long,but very interesting. the scuba mask on darth vader is interesting.but a good use. i wish there was more room in the cockpit.but it will do. i am sure i can figure out some way to create room.but the hidden missile is just perfect. the rogue shadow lego set is almost exactly like the one in the lego set.except for that it is gray. but that is just a small oversight, plus it looks better with black. but overall. it is a great Christmas gift. and it is worth fifty dollars

Pros 
hidden missile
three minifigs
its awesome

cons
nothing

author: fujikuro
title: Wonderful set!
review:
Truly a remarkable set here.  A fantastic, interesting build due to the off-balance design of the ship.  The only difficult is in sorting colors when building since everything is pretty much black.  Lots of play features, and three unique minifigs.  Overall, it's a fairly sturdy ship, and certainly very visually appealing for folks like me who prefer the non-symmetrical Star Wars ships.

My only complaint is the lack of an ability to house two minifigs inside.  Some modification would probably make that possible, but I personally don't own enough sets to have the spare parts to do so.  Need to pick some bulk Legos up at a garage sale or something...

Anyway, giving it 5 stars, though it's probably more like an 8.5/10.

author: Z_wing
title: the only the force unleashed set ever (so far)
review:
the fact that this is the only force unleashed set so far should not effect the coolness of this set in my opinion. maybe lego will do more the force unleashed sets to go with this set.

figures
pros: all are only found in this set, extra headgear
cons: none

ship
pros: cockpit system, many pop up features, wing system, landing gear, looks cool
cons: red missiles cannot be fired, not 100% airtight

pieces
pros: missile and missile launcher, cockpit window, both vader helmets, pilot hat, blasters
cons: none

build
pros: not easy but not hard, strong
cons: landing feet fall off sometimes

price
pros: worth it 
cons: expensive 

I recommend this set to fans of lego starwars

author: brickstud176
review:
I say this saet is half good and half bad with some pros and cons

pro

.rare minifigs
.great pieces
.all sorts of different gears
.hidden rockets and missles

con
.weak landing gear
.small cockpit
.way to fragle
.bit pricie

Thanks for reading!

author: Cona_Chris
title: Rogue Shadow Review
review:
Overall I really like the ship a lot - it came in numbered bags making assembly easy since you didn't have to serach through everything.


Pros

1) The levers on the sides to operate the missiles and the spring-loaded projectile are really a cool feature, as are the rotating wings on the sides.

2) The mini-figs!  My daughter loves the female characters so Juno was a big hit.

3) The storage spot for two blasters (although if it had room for two lightsabers instead that would have been better).  I geek out over hidden compartments!

4) Holds together well when "flying" around the basement :)


Cons

1) Landing gear comes off easily

2) I wish there was a bit more space in the area behind the cockpit so that the Apprentice could ride in the ship (a mini-fig can fit in now but then you can't close the roof all the way).

3) The black color looks great in pictures, but in real life, just like a black car, finger smudges and things are very noticable (not that you can't wipe them off, but it just never looks clean).


I got the set on sale (so I paid $40 instead of $50) at my local toy store - I wouldn't have paid $50 for it, that just seemed too much.  Overall I like this set a lot - a new genre and a unique design!

author: Niallskie
title: Unexpectedly cool
review:
I just got this a couple of days ago but did not got to build it till today. At first I had second thoughts of buying this as I am unfamiliar with the Forse Unleashed game and haven't seen this ship, but as an unexpected bargain went on at a local store, I just have to nab it for the sole reason of getting the figures. I went on to build this ship and was amazed of how it was after, the actual ship is sleak in my opinion and very playable. One of the thing I liked about this is the booster at the back and how it is an unconventional design. The ship is quite big but easy to swoop around, wings at first looked very weak and I thought it would fall off but was actually very sturdy. It has lots of hidden compartment, pop up features to reveal rockets, spring loaded missile and gun compartment. Got some pro's and con's on this ship coming up:

Pro's
- Awesome line up of minifigures
- Unique booster design
- Booster swing as wings swings up on landing
- Sturdy wings
- Lots of hidden arsenal
- Simple but fantastic landing gear design

Con's
- No place for other figures to sit on the ship
- Gears on the booster would have been better off colored black
- Rockets on the left side of ship keeps falling off ( had to modify it for it to stay)


Other than that this is a cool ship.

author: legoDad42
title: Cool Expanded Universe Ship!
review:
Cool looking ship from Lego Star Wars. This is from a video game(not the movies). Not sure if the design closely resembles the game ship (need to look it up). Interesting design though and fun to build. 

PRO's-Hidden compartment with trigger for a spring loaded missile, 2 red tipped(manual fire )missiles(hidden), hidden compartment for 2 laser rifles. Retractable landing gear, wings tilt from landing position to launch position, tilting cockpit canopy. Plus you get a very cool battle damaged Darth Vader figure (along with 2 other minifigures-a femal pilot(with choice of blond hair or a black officer cap)and another dark Jedi with light saber. These characters are again from the video game. 

CON's-Must be careful when building to line up the techniqe pieces to make the wings line up properly (pay attention to this step), landing gears comes off from time to time (meaning the feet of the landing gear), also would've been easy to design a way to fit another figure into the cockpit. 

Ship is better for a 10 year old on up.

author: obi_1_kenobi
title: Tiny Cockpit
review: Okay, it doesn't have everything it did in the force unleashed. No table with chairs, No light saber collection, Nothing like that. The cockpit is pretty pathetic. It can only hold one person where in the game it can fit half a dozen people. The features on the other hand are pretty cool like the gun storage, the missles (you have to pull them out) the firing rocket, and the turning wings and hyperdrive. It also comes with the regular helmet for Darth Vader but no regular torso or legs. For all the sticker haters, there are 3 imperial symbols. It doesn't make much of a difference if you don't put them on. The picture above only shows 2 stickers and for most pictures it only shows 1 sticker. Overall if you have the money just lying around then get it but it's not worth saving for.

author: The_Dumb_One
title: An oddity
review:
Well, when I first bought this set i wasn't exactly sure what it was... I had to go online and find out, but that wasn't too bad... Overall, this ship is amazing, although, as mentioned, the landing gear falls off frequently and there is not much room. I have also had problems with the big missile because it tends to hid the edge of the thing that launches it, though that might be my fault. The playability is very nice and overall, it's a great ship if you know all about The Force Unleashed series.

 

P.S.: It's a bit pricey, but hey, they all are...

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: The Price Tag Unleashed!
review:
It's not very often the Star Wars LEGO milieu is treated (word used ironically) to a set as pointless as this one.

Let's talk. Yes, The Force Unleashed is a marginally cool game. It's fun, exciting and interesting, with an affecting side story and good graphics. We play as a mysterious Apprentice to Darth Vader, codenamed 'Starkiller.' -Snort- sorry.

Starkiller's ship, the Rogue Shadow, is okay, too... or, at least it would be if it: appeared onscreen for more than forty-five seconds overall, displayed its offensive capabilities in some way, was actually playable in some form, if Starkiller piloted it himself and didn't have a pilot to chauffeur him around, or was in the least bit elaborated upon.

This craft has no real backstory, and doesn't really do a lot... in model form or in the game, comic and book. The model is a bit of a bore, quite frankly. Building it is a bland affair, with the same two colours -grey and black - throughout. Yes, it's supposed to be dark black and stealthy. But a little hue in the cockpit or somewhere would have been great. While on the subject of the cockpit, only Juno Eclipse - Starkiller's expert pilot - can fit inside, meaning she's only driving herself... and that defeats the portrayal of the craft in the first place! Oh well, at least it looks like Starkiller will be driving himself to work today, Vader. No carpools with Juno E.

The body of the ship is filled with loads of little firing missiles and antennae that look as if LEGO desperately shoehorned them in to try to make the model a little more fun. One set of missiles has no firing mechanism whatsoever and feels a little tacked on. The landing gear- oh, the landing gear is an unmitigated disaster. The pads keep falling off the belly of the RS and really are awkward, as they are situated in various places on the hull rather than in a pattern.

The name of the ship also sucks noodles.

It's a supremely dismal set, and the only saving grace is the figures. A damaged Darth Vader, Starkiller (okay, his real name is Galen Marek- it was supposed to be Jacob Nion, but that was dropped in lieu of the other one) and sassy flight officer Juno Eclipse. Some good figures, but you could probably pick them up separately with the right connections.

  • Pros:
  • Erm....
  • Uh...
  • Figures are cool
  • Some parts for a better Imperial vehicle, possibly a MOC?
  • Cons:
  • No real grip on the actual vehicle
  • Boring colours
  • Boring functions
  • Boring set
If you really want it, just get it. I wouldn't recommend it.

author: MovieNerd
title: What an ugly ship
review:
Out of all the ships in the Star Wars univers the "Rogue Shadow" is defintly one of the ugliest and is the same in Lego form. It's just an ugly and quite frankly odd looking ship. The way the wings and engine move into "flight" mode leave bright yellow pieces right in plain view that just don't look right on this grey/black ship. The landing gear feet fall off any time I move it and the two smaller missles are pointless. You can't flick them or fire them in any way and they don't even look cool.

The cockpit opening is kind of a cool design though and the mechanism for firing the big missle is really clever. Plus I like the minifigs even though there is no place for Vader's Apprentice to sit in the ship because the cockpit can only hold Juno. 

To sum up, it's ugly, the landing gear constantly falls off, so do the other missles that are useless, and a Battle Damaged Darth Vader minifig is just not reason worth getting this set.

Pass on the ship but if you find the minifigs by themselves get those.

author: roborovskilego
title: Weapons Galore!
review:
Rouge Shadow

       I think the Rouge Shadow is quite amazing personally, and my review will show you why.  Just in case you want this set, allow me to tell what you are about to purchase.


       Building Experience

        I had a great time building because it is not as repetitive as other Lego sets, because the Rouge Shadow is uneven.  I also enjoyed it because it is a great opportunity to see tons of the weapons and know how they work.  You have to push the pieces in hard though or else they will fall apart and it will be hard to repair it without damaging other parts.  I would rate the building experience five bricks because it sure is a treat to build this set!

          
        Parts

        Parts in this set are not hard to find because there is a reasonable amount and the parts are mostly visible.  If you dump the small parts into the big parts and start mixing it, surely, it will get trickier.  I recommend you keep the small parts where they were to begin with.  It's not just all about finding parts for me, I also judge it on the coolness of the parts.  If you have loads of Lego sets then get this one, the parts won't mean that much to you.  As to me, some of the parts are really awesome because I don't have very many sets.  I would give parts a four brick rating.

        
         Playability

         Here comes the best part! Unlike other sets, the Rouge Shadow opens on the top! That's the first cool feature.  Next, if you are facing it, there is a door on the left which you can open and there is a powerful cannon inside.  The door on the right has two blasters inside.  Also on the right, there is a knob that if you spin up, some miscilles  pop up!  The wings can go back and forth if you move the little quarter circle thing! It's not even hard to play with at all!  Obviously, this is a five brick rating!


         Value For Money

        Since I -as you can see- enjoyed this set, the value for money is high.  What I mean is this would be a five brick rating.


          Overall Rating

        Almost all of my categories are five stars, so you guessed it, it would be a five brick rating!  I hope you gathered a lot of information from this review!  If you have just gotten this set, enjoy! 

                                                        Roborovskilego

author: grr1231
title: Now This Is A Lego Set
review:
The MiniFigs             

                               The set comes with 3 minifigs,Starkiller,Juno Eclipse,and Battle Damaged Darth Vader.   

                             Minifig Pros: Exclusive Minifigs

                                              Different Light Saber Hilts

                            

                             Minifig Cons:No cape for Darth Vader        

 

           The Ship:                 

                           The Ship itself is big and sleek with a gun compartment,a hidden missle,and a small cockpit.                  

                             Ship pros: Sleek design

                                            Hidden gun compartment

                                            Secret Missle

                                            Cool wing turning thing          

                             Ship Cons: The Landing gear falls off sometimes

                                            The Cockpit is too small

author: orybloodmyre
title: Bulky and cumbersome, but suprisingly packed with more firepower than your average Mos Eisley cantina bar patron!
review:
I had wanted this set for a while, but the price put me off a bit, and it was only recently I managed to get one not tooo expensive.

 

For me, the build took quite a while, as I am not used to technic lego parts, and I had quite a few problems attaching the wing parts, as both side wouldn't allign, so one wing always seemed to be at a higher angle than the other. But after a lot of taking apart and putting back together I got it looking right!

 

After construction, I couldn't believe how big and bulky it was! I only own two other spaceships, the original x-wing fighter from 1999 and also the the naboo starfighter from around the same time. This dwarfs both of them! It's pretty solid, so its fine to 'swoosh' around without worrying its going to break, and has lots of playability in terms of a pop out cannon that fires a missile, a hidden compartment with 2 imperial blaster rifles, and another missile storage compartment, though I have trouble shooting them out. I think they are supposed to be flick out, but I still fail at it!

 

One issue I have with the ship is the cockpit simply will not fit Galen Marek and and Juno, its either one or the other, which is a shame as in the force unleashed game you see that the cockpit can hold Master Kota and PROXY as well as Marek and Juno. so it is a dissapointment only one character can fit in the ship.

 

The mini figures are fantastic with this set. The Marek figure has some form of training outfit on, with a bandaged wound from where he was stabbed by vader, (though in the game he never actually has a bandage on!) Vader comes in battle damaged form, with two alternate head pieces, either his helmet of an upside down divers mask piece which looks suprisingly like a shattered helmet. Juno is also brilliantly done, with either a blonde hair piece or a pilots cap. What I like about the facial printing is that with the cap on, she has a fringe printed on her forehead.

 

So aside from the tiny ammount of room in the cockpit, in all this is a fantastic set. Its a shame it didnt come with any interesting pieces, exclusive to this set, like perhaps a sith holocron, or something so as you could make the apprentice into the alternate evil version unlockable at the end of the game. But this set is definately brilliant, an accurate depiction of the Rogue Shadow in the force unleashed, and a must have if you plan on starting a Rebel Alliance!

author: raymondg
title: Great and unjustly overlooked little gem!
review:
I recently purchased this set and I was pleasantly surprised by it. Although this ship is largely unknown as it only appeared in a SW videogame, the model itself is outstanding in every way. This is one of those rare asymmetrical models and although it mostly fails aesthetically, this one seems to pull it off. Playability of this one is through the roof; It offers the most play features I ever saw in one vehicle / ship! Overall it is quite sturdy and landing gear falling off is something I did not experience nor foresee in the future. I guess it's all a matter of proper assembly...
The colors are mostly grey and black so it may seem a tad boring to look at but that's all a matter of taste. It certainly will stand out in your SW collection where most stuff is grey and white.

Pros

  • Sturdy and quite swooshable
  • Lots of play features like: a catapult-like missilething, a 'missile-silo' and a gun compartment.
  • A very nice cockpit with a mechanism similar to the top hatch of the Republic MTT

Cons

  • Color palette may seem a bit dull but in real life it looks the bomb!

In summary I can wholeheartedly say: buy it if you find it for a reasonable price as most of today's models certainly pale in comparison to this one in terms of playability and originality.

author: Chills
title: The ship that helped start the Rebellion... according to The Force Unleashed.
review:
I'm a fan of "The Force Unleashed" video game, which is what prompted me to get this unusual set. Overall I think this is a decent set, it has some cool features, but it isn't great and it feels lacking in some areas.

Pros

  • Pro 1: LEGO did a pretty good job taking a video game ship and turning it into a set. The Rogue Shadow is a highly unusual-looking starship, it has engines off to one side, the wings are different on each side, the cockpit is far back and behind part of the fuselage, and the fuselage itself is asymmetrical. All are reflected accurately in the set.
  • Pro 2: The build is pretty fun. There are 8 different sections and all are held together with Technic pins and bricks. This is quite a different building technique than what you normally see with SW ships.
  • Pro 3: There is good playability with this set. It is sturdy, swooshable, and has quit a few features. Each section of the fuselage opens up to reveal hidden weapons, and the cockpit actually hinges back in a most unusual way. The engine bank also rotates, which causes the wings to rotate from horizontal to vertical. 
  • Pro 4: I really dig the minifigures. Starkiller (our hero) has some good detail on his body, as does Juno Eclipse. Vader is the best, though, with a battle damaged helmet (actually a diver's mask turned sideways) and body.

Cons

  • Con 1: The biggest negative about this set is its unfinished feel. There are no bottoms to the fuselage, its just open. I understand its part of the design to allow access to the weapons, but it makes the ship feel like LEGO forgot to add pieces. The same goes for parts of the fuselage. On the starboard side the top part, which rotates up, just kind of sits on the sides with a large gap in the pieces. It just looks unfinished and not up to the usual LEGO refinement.
  • Con 2: Even though 3 minifigures are cool this set should have had Proxy, too. Not only is he integral to the plot of the game, but he would make a really cool mini figure for your collection.

Overall I am pleased with this set, but I don't think it is one of LEGO's best efforts. It is a cool set, fun to build, but the unfinished feel keeps me from giving it more than 3 bricks. The minifigures are great, and one of the reasons I wanted this set. Unless you must have all SW sets or are a big fan of the video game I would say most collectors can pass on this one.

author: Malurus
title: Not bad, LEGO...
review:
I like this set. Great minifigs, detail, and pieces.

Pros

  • Pro 1. Very nice detail, looks very much like the Video Game.
  • Pro 2. Minifigs are exclusive, great detail. I like hoe they use an old piece for Darth Vader instead of using an entirely new one.
  • Pro 3. Great set.

Cons

  • Con 1. Has the missile element, which is not in the Video Game.
  • Con 2. Juno having eye color when everyone else doesn't makes her the oddball out, and is wierd to see two people with black eyes and not her.
  • Con 3. It feels incomplete, like it is missing something...

Overall, great set! I was very impressed when I got the game to see how much it looked like it. The cons are minor and don't block out any pros.

author: psychman7
title: Star Wars Set #11: 7672 Rogue Shadow
review:
Even though this set doesn't come from the six films, it's a pretty cool ship. It's packed with features like the TIE crawler, and it looks amazing.

Box/Instructions:
The box is a decent size for a fifty-dollar set. It looks intimidating as it flies over Mustafar, firing its missiles from it's port-side...wing, I guess you could call it. And for the first time, I got a box that contained numbered bags. They play a pretty great role later in the Star Wars line, especially as you approach 2010. I believe this is the only 2008 set that had numbered bags. I have no complaints, though. It makes the building more fun and interesting. Eight numbered bags are included in this set. This is a thing that will appear in most of my reviews: what each numbered bag holds. They too will have their own section of the review.
-Bag One contains the three minifigures and the cockpit of the ship.
-Bag Two contains the rear starboard section of the ship.
-Bag Three contains the starboard "wing". Let's just stick with that term.
-Bag Four contains the rear port section of the ship.
-Bag Five contains port wing, as well as the section that crosses in front of the cockpit.
-Bag Six contains some extra detailing. (landing gear, weapons, and outer armor)
-Bag Seven contains the starboard-side wings. These don't use quotes, because they legitimately are wings.
-Bag Eight contains the port-side wing and the special weapon.
The instructions are split into two booklets. Book one constructs bags one through five, and bag two constructs bags six through eight. The build goes so much faster this way.

The Stickers:
There are only three stickers here, and all of them are the Imperial logo. To be honest, only one is used, and is placed on the port-side rear section.

The Pieces:
Lots of black and dark gray pieces are used here, but that's how most sinister Imperial ships look. The technic shooter is introduced once again, put into the ship at bag six, but I'll get more in-depth about that later. The cockpit piece is also a great piece to have.

The Minifigures:
All of the minifigures are built in bag one. The first one built is the battle-damaged Darth Vader. He is an excellent figure, and I love his "blown-up helmet" piece. He also includes a full helmet. Starkiller is the next figure, and he is probably the best figure of the set. Like Vader, he includes a red lightsaber. The front detailing is phenomenal, so I wouldn't mess with him. The third figure is officer Juno Eclipse. She also has two headpieces. One of them is a black officer cap, and the other is her blonde hair. She is also a very great figure.

The Rogue Shadow:
I'll divide the review into eight sections, because of how many numbered bags are included.
Bag One:
The first thing to be constructed is the cockpit module. When finished, the cockpit can open up to fit one minifigure inside (I've put Juno in there most of the time). There is also a little back compartment, and I use that to store a weapon of some sort. When Starkiller pilots the ship, that's where I store his lightsaber. I would say the cockpit could open at the front, but seeing as it gets blocked off by the crossblock (which I will talk about later), it doesn't really count as a feature.
Bag Two:
After the cockpit is finished off, you build the rear starboard section. This is how the rotating wing mechanism is born. As you rotate the awesome-looking engine module, it rotates a technic gear, which will move the wings. The gear is yellow, so it stands out in contrast to the almost-completely-black ship. Nonetheless, the feature is very much effective.
Bag Three:
The front starboard section contains the panel in which the technic shooter pops out. The shooter itself isn't built in this part, the panel is. The panel opens up almost all the way back.
Bag Four:
The rear port section contains two "flick-fire missiles". They aren't really flick-fire, but they are removable. A lever at the side of the ship pops them up. Sometimes they actually come out of their spots, so it's somewhat effective.
Bag Five:
The front port section is thinner than the starboard side, but it too has a panel that you can open almost completely the whole way. In this section, however, is a storage area for two blaster rifles. This section also builds the crossblock, which prevents the windscreen from opening outward as mentioned in Bag One.
Bag Six:
More detail is added to the ship as you begin the second manual and the sixth bag. The shooter is added into the starboard panel, where it pops out with a lever underneath. when the shooter's lever makes contact with the edge of the ship, the shooter pops out. The shooter, of course, isn't added until last. The landing gear is also attached to the ship. It folds in and out as it flies and lands. Finally, the weapons are added onto the ship.
Bag Seven:
The starboard-side wing is added. There really isn't a feature to this, except it rotates thanks to the mechanics of Bag Two.
Bag Eight:
The port-side with is now added on, as well as the rocket. That completes the ship, basically.
Overall:
When finished, the ship looks very nice and sinister. The asymmetry is a good look for the ship. The one thing you have to keep in mind is that you should fold up the landing gear before turning the wing mechanism. When that's done, you're good to go and ready to fly!

The Final Verdict:
Pieces - 10/10 - A great selection of parts, especially the cockpit and technic shooter.
Stickers - 10/10 - Only three, and only one is used!
Minifigures - 10/10 - All excellent!
Rogue Shadow - 9/10 - The missile function (not the shooter) doesn't work as well as one would like, so that docks a couple points.

Final result - 9.75/10 - A very nice and fun ship that's loaded with fun. Enjoy it!
